intro: Amphilophium scabriusculum, commonly known as the rough-leaved philophium, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and swamps. Its foliage is often covered in fine, stiff hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. The species is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants.
